revised_title: Fluidity and Horizon Formation in Molten Organic Salts
tldr: The authors developed a simple horizon test to study the fluidity of molten organic salts and their mesophases. They found that sodium isovalerate behaves as a completely fluid melt above 260°C, while molten sodium w-butyrate remains fluid throughout its entire mesophase range. The test provides insights into the mechanical properties and fluidity of these organic salts, which have complex melting mechanisms and unique characteristics.
